methods.name: shootBBGunProjectile
methods.doc:
Spawn a BB gun projectile. It works only if Blockbuster mod is present.

ProTip: To get the gun props' NBT code, configure a desired BB gun, and grab it into you main hand. Execute /item_nbt false command in the chat, paste the NBT into the script, and remove {Gun: in the beginning and a } in the end.

{@code
     c.getSubject().shootBBGunProjectile('{Gun:{Damage:1.0f,Projectile:{Meta:0b,Block:"minecraft:stone",Name:"block"},Gravity:0.0f}}')
 }

methods.doc:
Moves the entity to the specified position (x, y, z) with the given interpolation type and duration. The following interpolation types are supported:

    ยง7
  • linear
    • ยงr ยง7
  • quad_in
    • ยงr ยง7
  • quad_out
    • ยงr ยง7
  • quad_inout
    • ยงr ยง7
  • cubic_in
    • ยงr ยง7
  • cubic_out
    • ยงr ยง7
  • cubic_inout
    • ยงr ยง7
  • exp_in
    • ยงr ยง7
  • exp_out
    • ยงr ยง7
  • exp_inout
    • ยงr ยง7
  • back_in
    • ยงr ยง7
  • back_out
    • ยงr ยง7
  • back_inout
    • ยงr ยง7
  • elastic_in
    • ยงr ยง7
  • elastic_out
    • ยงr ยง7
  • elastic_inout
    • ยงr ยง7
  • bounce_in
    • ยงr ยง7
  • bounce_out
    • ยงr ยง7
  • bounce_inout
    • ยงr ยง7
  • sine_in
    • ยงr ยง7
  • sine_out
    • ยงr ยง7
  • sine_inout
    • ยงr ยง7
  • quart_in
    • ยงr ยง7
  • quart_out
    • ยงr ยง7
  • quart_inout
    • ยงr ยง7
  • quint_in
    • ยงr ยง7
  • quint_out
    • ยงr 
{@code
    var s = c.getSubject();
    var pos = s.getPosition();
    s.moveTo("quad_out", 30, pos.x, pos.y+2, pos.z);
 }

arguments.doc: The interpolation type used for the movement.

arguments.doc: The duration of the movement in ticks.

createCompoundFromJS
methods.doc:
Turn a JS object into an NBT compound.

BEWARE: when converting JS object to NBT keep in mind some limitations of the NBT format:

  • NBT supports multiple number storage formats (byte, short, int, long, float, double) so the converter will only be able to convert numbers to either integer or double NBT tags, depending on how did you got the number, 42 being an integer, and 42.0 being a double.
  • NBT lists support only storage of a single type at once, so if you provide an JS array like [0, 1, 2, "test", {a:1,b:2}, 4, [0, 0, 0], 5.5] then only the the first element's type will be taken in account, and the resulted NBT list will turn out like [0.0d, 1.0d, 2.0d, 4.0d, 5.5d]. In case with numbers if you had first integers, and somewhere in the middle in the list you got a double, then the integer type will get converted to double!
{@code
    var tag = mappet.createCompoundFromJS({id:"minecraft:diamond_hoe",Count:1});
    var item = mappet.createItemNBT(tag);

    // {id:"minecraft:diamond_hoe",Count:1b,Damage:0s}
    c.send(item.serialize());
 }

dumpJSON
methods.doc:
Dumps to a JSON String. It first replaces the key-value colons with the proper JSON format. Then, it creates a pattern to match the desired numeric literals and boolean values. It checks if the current matched pattern is "0b" or "1b" and replaces them with "false" and "true" respectively. For the other cases, it removes the last character from the matched pattern, effectively removing the type literal. 
{@code
   var tag = mappet.createCompound("{id:\"minecraft:diamond_hoe\",Count:1b}");
   c.send(tag.dumpJSON());
 }

Image argument is a so called "resource location." For example, if you want to draw pig's skin on the screen you can input "minecraft:textures/entity/pig/pig.png" and it will draw it on the screen.

classes.name: mchorse.mappet.api.ui.components.UIComponent
classes.doc:
Base UI component.

Every UI component in UI API is based off this base component, and therefore they have all of the methods available for changing ID, margins, frame (x, y, width, and height), tooltip, visibility, enabled, keybinds and update delay.

methods.name: id
methods.doc:
Set the ID of the component.

Without ID, the data that can be inputted by players won't be sent into the script handler, so it is required to set component's ID if you want to receive the data from the component.

BEWARE: multiple components must not share same ID, if they will it will certainly cause bugs in the data that you'll be receiving from the client and the way you retrieve components using {@link IMappetUIContext#get(String)}.

packages.name: mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user
mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.mappet
packages.doc:
Welcome to Mappet's in-game scripting documentation!

Scripts are JavaScript (ES 5.1) programs that allow you to program game logic.

Scripts are stored in world's mappet/scripts/ folder. The filename without extension of the script is its ID. Depending on the configuration of the script, there might be an additional JSON file with extra non-code data.

Here are global variable(s) that are provided by Mappet:

  • mappet, it's a {@link mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.IScriptFactory}. It allows you to create and query different Minecraft or Mappet data structures.

There are currently two packages available in Mappet:

  • Scripting API section covers functions that allow you to interact with Minecraft's mechanics to some extent and with Mappet.
  • UI API section covers functions that allow you to create custom user intrfaces (UI) which can be used for plethora of things.

Big thanks to TorayLife for scripting API suggestions.
